dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy drags unconscious pilot, Oveur, down center aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE (v.o.) This is due to periodic air pockets we encounter. There is no reason to become alarmed, and we hope you enjoy the rest of your flight. By the way, is there anyone on В­board who knows how to fly a plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolute pandemonium. Passengers are yelling, screaming, tearing their hair out and climbing around. A naked woman runs down the aisle. Sister Mary is choking a Krishna. Tw passengers are dueling with swords. A Spanish-speaking la waits for her husband to translate the announcement, then panics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND of car screeching to a stop. PAUL CAREY, twenty-fou year-old, cleancut, naive-looking, navigator trainee ente and pushes doorbell. We HEAR the typical eight-note chime progression. The CHIMES then play the Air Force Fight son A dog BARKS and MRS. KRAMER opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAREY Hello, I'm Paul Carey from the airline. I'm here to pick up Captain Kramer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. KRAMER Oh, yes. Come in, Paul. Rex will be right out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Carey enters, a big dog jumps on him with its paws o his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. KRAMER Shep, sit...sit! So, I understand you've got a real emergency down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAREY (holding off dog) Well, to tell the truth, they really didn't fill me in on many of the details. Just told me to pick up Captain Kramer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. KRAMER Something about a plane with no pilot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carey begins to lose battle with the dog, while trying to remain polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAREY Yeah, something like that, but as I say, they didn't have time to tell me very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. KRAMER Shep, no! I'll bet you have exciting things happen all the time down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep is growling and Carey's arm is locked firmly in his Jaws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAREY Well...the airline business...does have... its moments...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shep pins Carey against the wall, ripping his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAREY ...but after...awhile...you begin to... (gasp) ...get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. KRAMER Shep, no! He gets so excited when new people are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a THUD and loud growling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. KRAMER Are you a pilot yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carey is on the floor desperately fighting off the dog, which is on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAREY I'm...in a...argh...navigator training program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER enters, buttoning his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER It's unbelievable! How many times have I warned those people about food inspection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer is tying his tie in the mirror. In the corner of t mirror, Carey is being thrashed by the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER The airport management, the F.A.A., and the airlines, they're all cheats and liars! All right, let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER and lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is talking to Krishnas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Sorry to bother you. We were just looking for someone with flying experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy exits. They return to reading their PLAYRAMA magazi with a female Hari Krishna in a sexy pose on the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARI KRISHNA #1 Hari Rama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARI KRISHNA #2 Rama Rama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker is sitting next to a MAN FROM INDIA in a business suit and turban.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER You see, the day we left the village it was raining, so we had to take a special jeep to the main road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Indian is dousing himself with a can of gasoline. In b.g. Randy is talking to passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER In fact, we were lucky to even get a jeep since just the day before the only one we had broke down -- it had a bad axle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Indian lights a match to immolate himself. Randy approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Excuse me, sir. There's been a little problem in the cockpit and I was wondering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER The cockpit? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY It's the little room at the front of the plane where the pilots sit. But that's not important right now. The first officer is ill and the Captain would like someone with flying experience to help him with the radio. Do you know anything about planes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Indian holds the match, awaiting the outcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Well, I flew in the war, but that was a long time ago. I wouldn't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Would you go up, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a moment of indecision. The Indian encourages Stri with an adamant nod. Striker gets up to leave. The Indian relieved, blows out the match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is sitting across the aisle from a 65-year-old conВ­servatively dressed SPINSTER. He pulls a flask from coat pocket and takes a swig. She eyes him disВ­approving

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK Would ya like a little whiskey, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPINSTER  (insulted) Certainly not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She inserts a two inch straw in her nose and snorts a cou lines of cocaine off a piece of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (to Rumack and Randy) The stewardess said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty pilot's seat and inflated automatic pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Both pilots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK Can you fly this airplane and land it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Surely you can't be serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK I am serious, and don't call me Shirley! What flying experience have you had?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Well, I flew single-engine fighters in the Air Force, but this plane has four engines. It's an entirely different kind of flying...all together!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY/RUMACK (all together) It's an entirely different kind of flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Besides, I haven't touched any В­kind of plane in six years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK Mister Striker. I know nothing about flying. All I know is this: you're the only person on this plane who can possibly fly it. You're the only chance we've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRAMATIC MUSIC as Striker turns to face the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS controls. CAMERA KEEPS PANNING and PANNING as SEE more and more controls ad absurdum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT METER - $ll5.25. The businessman in Striker's cab checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (to Air Controller) Tell Omaha to acknowledge and standby. (into phone) Get every piece of emergency equipment you can reach. (to Air Controller) Alert at every mile of the way from here to the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hinshaw grabs Air Controller #1's tummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW Would anyone care for a roll and coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #2 Chief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY We'll need a pre-landing flight check. Tell 'em I'm in the dispatch office and I want it here fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #2 It's your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (into phone) I want the kids in bed by nine. I want the dog fed, the yard watered, and the gate locked. And get a note to the milkman -- no more cheese!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams dowm the phone. He leans his hands on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Where the hell is Kramer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the wall behind him there is a picture of McCroskey leaning his hands on a desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer and a mutilated Carey are en route to airport. Kra is at the wheel. Through rear window is obvious REAR PROJECTION of passing road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into phone) No, we can't do that; the risk of a flameout is too great. Keep him 24,000. No, feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER One of the passengers is going to land that plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAREY Is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Possible, but it's a hundred to one shot. Thousand to one. I know this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAREY You do? Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear A THUNK. REAR PROJECTION shows he has run oyer a bicyclist, who stands and gives the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER His name is Ted Striker. I flew with him during the war. And that won't make my job any easier tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REAR PROJECTION SPEEDS UP to obvious FAST MOTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Ted Striker was a crack flight leader up to a point. But he was one of those men who, well, let's just say he felt too much inside. Maybe you know the kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now REAR PROJECTION indicates car is turning and then weaving, but Kramer does not move wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER It takes a certain type to perform under pressure. Striker didn't have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now REAR PROJECTION is cowboys and Indians on horsebac chasing and shooting at Kramer's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Ate his heart out over every name on the casualty lists. The upshot of it is that he went all to pieces on one particular mission. Let's just hope it doesn't happen again tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER and lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker is in pilot's seat. Rumack is standing behind him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Let's see, altitude twenty-four thousand feet, level flight, air speed four hundred sixty knots, course zero niner zero, trim, mixture, landing gear, balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE Ted! What are you doing? You can't fly this plane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER That's what I've been trying to tell these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK Elaine, I haven't time to put this gently, so I'll be very direct. Everyone of us on this plane is in a desperate situation. Mister Striker is the only hope we've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Let's see. Those are the flaps, that's the thrust, this must turn on the landing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips a switch. The plane dives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is diving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is standing at toilet. He is jolted back and forth against the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flashing:              RETURN TO SEAT GOBACKEN SIDONNA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (into mike) Mayday!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (v.o.) Mayday! Mayday!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (surprised) Mayday? What the hell is that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW It's the Russian New Year! We'll have a parade! They'll serve hot hors d'oeuvres!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker flips switch and rights plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Level flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (v.o.) Two-zero-niner, are you okay up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Yeah, I was just trying out the landing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine and Rumack exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. HAMMEN I've got to get out of here! I can't stand it! I've got to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pushes up and shakes Mrs. Hammen by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Calm down. Get hold of yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK Stewardess, let me handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy leaves, Jack shakes Mrs. Hammen by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK Get hold of yourself! Get hold of yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK (to Jack) Get back to your seat; I'll take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack leaves; Rumack shakes Mrs. Hammen by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK Calm down. Calm down. Get hold of yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Angelina taps Rumack on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SISTER ANGELINA (to Rumack) Doctor, you're wanted on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Angelina starts shaking Mrs. Hammen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SISTER ANGELINA Everything will be all right. Please get hold of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a line of passengers behind Sister Angelina waitin to shake Mrs. Hammen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reads:         CHICAGO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kramer rushes through the lobby, he is approached by a series of religious zealots. In quick succession he decks each one karate style, shooting the last zealot twenty fe away with a .44 Magnum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.A. #1 (v.o.) Your attention, please. Flight four-one- seven now departing the B Concourse, gate six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.A. #2 (v.o.) Your attention, please. Flight twenty- seven now arriving the B Concourse, gate six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a LOUD CRASH, and the SCENE SHAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #1 (into phone) This guy doing the flying has no airline experience at all. He'll be a menace to himself and everything else in the air... (he pauses to listen) ...Yes, birds too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer enters, picks up clipboard, and reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (into phone) Okay, okay. He's a terrible risk, but what other choice have we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey hangs up phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Well, that's the whole story, Rex, everything we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER All right, Steve, let's face a few facts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer whips off his sunglasses. Underneath is another pa of sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER As you know, I flew with this man, Striker, during the war. He'll have enough on his mind without remembering those days when -- well, when things weren't so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Well, right now things aren't so good. And while we're talking there are a hundred and thirty-eight lives waiting on us for a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Let me tell you something, Steve. Striker was a top-notch squadron leader -- a long time ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spear slams into the wall behind Kramer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER ...but my feeling is that when the going gets rough upstairs tonight, Ted Striker's gonna fold up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Look, Rex -- I want you to get on the horn and talk this guy down! You're going to have to let him get the feel of this airplane on the way; you'll have to talk him onto the approach; and so help me, you'll have to talk him right down to the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A watermelon falls from TOP OF FRAME, splattering on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Very well then. Put Striker on the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Okay, you can use the radio over there. Looks like I picked the wrong week to quit drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a flask trom the drawer and takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer at dispatch radio. He picks up mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Striker, Striker, this is Captain Rex Kramer speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey joins Kramer at dispatch radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRAMATIC MUSIC as we see Striker's ominous look of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (dramatically) Yes, Captain Kramer. Read you loud and clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer sits at the mike. An Air Controller is standing ne to him, but only his mid-section is in FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER All right. It's obvious you remember me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Air Controller is scratching his behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER So what do you say you and I just forget about everything except what we have to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Air Controller is now scratching his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER You and I are going to bring this plane in together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Air Controller's hand is now inside his pants straightening out his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Before we start, I'd like to say something. I know that right now things must look pretty rough up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Air Controller is now hopping around with both hands inside his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER But if you do what I tell you, when I tell you to do it, there's no reason you can't bring that plane in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Let's not kid each other, Kramer. You know I've never flown a bucket like this. I'm going to need all the luck there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Stand by, Striker. (to McCroskey) The one hope we have is to build this man up. I've got to give him all the confidence I can. (into microphone) All right, Striker, have you ever flown a multi-engine plane before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (v.o.) No. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker over hears conversation on radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) This is a goddamn waste of time. There's no way he can land this plane! Route 'em into Lake Michigan and at least avoid killing innocent people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Grab hold of yourself! You've got to talk them down. You're the only chance they've got!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer lights cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into mike) All right, Striker, now you listen to me and you listen close. Flying is no different than riding a bicycle...it just happens to be a lot harder to put baseball cards in the spokes. Now, if you just follow my instructions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two vultures are sitting on back of Striker's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) ...there's no reason why you shouldn't have complete confidence in your chances to come out of this thing alive and in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER First, I want you to familiarize yourself with the controls. Later we'll run through the landing procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer takes a last drag on his cigarette and tosses it o the window. McCroskey plugs his ears with his fingers and ducks as though Kramer had thrown a grenade. There is an EXPLOSION O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER All right. Now I'd like you to disengage the automatic pilot. But watch any violent movement of the controls, like you used to make in Spitfires and Phantoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (into microphone) Okay, I'm going to unlock the automatic pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker switches off automatic pilot button. Automatic pi shoots upward out of the seat. Elaine is thrown to the floor. Striker struggles desperately to control the plane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flying erratically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) (matter of factly) Just remember, the controls will feel very heavy compared to a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker is fighting the wheel and the autopilot which is drifting in his way. Finally, he throws the autopilot to rear of the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) Don't worry about that. It's perfectly normal. You must watch your airspeed closely. Don't let it fall below 520. Both your rudder pedals and elevator trim will have additional play due to increased drag, but you can compensate by lowering manifold pressure below 154. Now there's one other thing. Have you someone up there who can work the radio and leave you free for flying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Yes! The stewardess is here with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine rises. The autopilot is on her back, its hands clinging to her breasts. She removes it and seats it at engineer's console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) Have her take the co-pilot's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine takes her seat as Striker regains control of the plane. He hands Elaine the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER The radio's all yours now. And keep an eye on that number three engine. It's running a little hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LITTLE HOT is blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) Striker, what kind of weather are you in up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE (into microphone) Rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER And a little ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE And a little ice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) How's it handling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Sluggish. Like a wet sponge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE (into microphone) Sluggish. Like a wet sponge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) (patronizing) All right, Striker, you're doing just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (to Elaine) It's a damn good thing he doesn't know how much I hate his guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE (into microphone) It's a damn good thing you don't know how much he hates your guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Black Dude is holding his stomach in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK DUDE Oooooooh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Can I get something for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK DUDE Cain fo' gwine sho fi cun for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY I'm sorry. I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SCHIFF, a middle-aged woman, is seated behind the Bl Dudes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SCHIFF Oh, stewardess, I can speak jive. He said he's in great pain and wants to know if you can help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Tell him to relax and I'll be back as quickly as I can with some medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SCHIFF Shi gwine man chitlun down for mo sho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK DUDE (indignantly) Shi man I ain neba mo fo gwine ain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They engage in an argument in jive talk, with Mrs. Schiff getting the best of it. She swaggers off in typical black dude fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Angelina is singing to the Krishnas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SISTER ANGELINA '...I sit by the telephone for hours. I love when men send me flowers. I enjoy being a girl.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is comforting an ailing Shirley. She is perВ­spiring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK How ya doing, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIRLEY Oh Jack, I'm so warm. I'm burning up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches up and opens the overhead air nozzle. Air rush out with hurricane force. As Jack struggles to turn off nozzle, Shirley is blown about, an adjacent passenger's papers go flying from a briefcase, a Hari Krishna's toga flies up revealing polka dot boxer shorts. An extra's tou flies off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON After my wife died, I felt like a fifth wheel. You know, so many years being with one person -- a very wonderful person -- makes you always think of yourself as part of a pair...When Ethel passed away, I was lost. I couldn't function socially and I couldn't function in business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNICE Well, after a thing like that you wouldn't be expected to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON But I think it's time we stopped talking about me. A woman like you -- why haven't you ever married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNICE Well, I'm afraid that's a question that's all too easy to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON I know the answer -- Career. A smart woman like you became so involved in your work, you didn't have time for marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNICE I wish I could fool myself into believing that that's the reason. The truth of the matter is, nobody ever asked me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON You know, here we are having coffee together, and discussing education and business and economy...and we don't even know each other's names...full names I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNICE Mine's Eleanor. Eleanor Schiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON That's a lovely name. Mine's Milton...Milt Ettenhenim. But my friends call me 'Bubbles.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy approaches Mrs. Schiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Would you care for a soft drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SCHIFF I'd be glad to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy hands a large bottle of Coca Cola wrapped in a baby blanket to Ms. Schiff, who cradles it in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SCHIFF Ooooh, such a nice soft drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS OUT to reveal Dispatcher typing message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RADIO (v.o.) National Weather Service reporting Omaha fogged in. Visibility zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dispatcher attempts to remove the message, but it is stuck in the cartridge. He yanks on it, but the paper stretches out like rubber. The scene now becomes like a cartoon. He lodges his feet against the typewriter and pu until the paper stretches to his face. He grumbles in Don Duck voice. The typewriter snaps back and hits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (to Air Controller #2) Macias, get me Captain Oveur's wife on the phone. We'd better let her know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Controller #1 rushes in holding a piece of paper and hands it to McCroskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #1 Steve, this weather bulletin just came off the wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey frowns and hands it to Hinshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Johnny, what can you make out of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW This? Why, I could make a hat or a broach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey grabs the note from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. OVEUR is in bed. Phone on night table RINGS. She reaches for it sleepily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. OVEUR Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #2 (v.o.) Missus Oveur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. OVEUR Yes, this is Missus Oveur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #2 (v.o.) This is Ed Macias calling from the airport. There's some trouble on your husband's flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT WIDENS to reveal she is sleeping with a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #2 (v.o.) We don't know how serious it is yet, but Harry Ballard thought you'd want to get down here right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. OVEUR I'll be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up the phone and rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. OVEUR I've got to go to the airport. You can let yourself out the back door. There's juice in the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HORSE (sounding like Mr. Ed) Did you finish? Was I good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. OVEUR Oh, you're all so concerned about performance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER and lightning; turbulent weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy approaches Mrs. Schiff, who is caring for a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Would you care for another drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SCHIFF No, thank you, I'm still nursing this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is bottle feeding the Coke bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SCHIFF (to bottle) There, just a little bit more -- and then burpie time and a good nap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine hangs up phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE Doctor Rumack says the sick people are getting worse and we're running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker is perspiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER'S THOUGHTS (v.o.) (echoing) I've got to concentrate, concentrate, entrate, I've got to concentrate, oncentrate, oncentrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He becomes aware of ECHO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER'S THOUGHTS (v.o.) (echoing) Hell, hello, ello, ello, ello, lo, lo. Echo, echo, echo, cho, cho, o, o, o, o, o. Pinch hitting for Pedro Bourbone, Manny Mota, Mota, Mota, Mota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nose dowm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE (v.o.) (hysterically) Ted, the altitude! We're falling, we're falling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER and lightning. Flying nose down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Woman applying eye makeup, smears it over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRAMATIC MUSIC as Striker is struggling with the conВ­tro Windshield wipers are moving as though directing music. S Christopher statue is holding an umbrella. Striker regain control of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK (to Rumack) What's going on? We have a right to know the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK (to passengers) All right. I'm going to level with you. The most important thing now is that you should all be calm, because there's no reason to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumack's nose elongates slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK Now, it is true that one of the flight crew has been taken ill...slightly ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His nose is getting longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK But the other two pilots are just fine and at the controls flying the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumack's nose is a foot long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK The weather in Chicago is clear as a bell, and there's no reason that we won't land on schedule...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers listening. His nose grows THROUGH FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK ...safe and sound and free to pursue a life of religious fulfillment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (into microphone) Chicago, the passengers are beginning to panic. When do we start down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into microphone) Not just yet, we'll have you in radar range any second now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (to McCroskey) I don't understand it. He should have been in range ten minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (into microphone) Gunderson, check the radar range. Anything yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNDERSON opens door of Amana Radar Range and peers in. There is a turkey inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNDERSON (into microphone) About two more minutes, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Two more minutes! They could be miles off course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER That's impossible. They're on instruments!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine, Randy, Rumack, and Striker are playing trumpet, clarinet, saxophone and bass fiddle in Benny Goodman swin band style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER This is gonna be a real sweat. (into mike) Gunderson, let me know when you get anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY I can't take much more of this! Johnny, how about some more coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW Would you like half of my provolone and roast beef?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Looks like I picked the wrong week to quit amphetamines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops a couple pills. Fifteen REPORTERS, Cameramen, etc enter with Air Controller #l.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #1 (to McCroskey) Steve, these reporters won't leave without a statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER #1 How much longer can the sick passengers hold out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Half hour...maybe forty-five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER #2 Who's flying the plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Controller #2 enters and hands McCroskey a note. Hand holding microphones are thrust INTO FRAME in front of McCroskey. One hand is holding an ice cream cone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY One of the passengers. But he's an experienced air force pilot who flew during the war so there's no cause for alarm. Hinshaw, take over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER #3 Have the families been notified?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW I think Florence Henderson knows about it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER #1 What are the chances of bringing this plane in safely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW What are the chances of returning something to Montgomery Ward the week after Christmas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER #1 (beckoning to door) All right, boys. Let's get some pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three men with cameras enter and begin to remove framed pictures from walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coming off press. SUPERIMPOSE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Series of spinning newspapers. CAMERA ZOOMS IN to each as stops spinning so that we can read headlines. Headlines a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "CHICAGO TIMES"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "NEW YORK TRIBUNE"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "NATIONAL INQUIRER"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA ZOOMS in to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWSCASTER Striken Airliner Approaches Chicago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arab newcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Japanese newscast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWSCASTER is an African in native dress with a bone in h nose. There is a graphic of an airplane behind him and he beating on a hollow log with sticks. The CAMERA ANGLE CHANGES and he switches to look into NEW CAMERA, and continues beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK KILPATRICK Shana, they bought their tickets, they knew what they were getting into. I say, let 'em crash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMING firetrucks, police cars, and ambulances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning and THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK Will the hospital equipment be at the airport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Yes, everything they've got. How are the passengers doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK I won't deceive you, Mister Striker. We're running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Surely there must be something you can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK I'm doing everything I can! -- And stop calling me Shirley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumack leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER'S THOUGHTS (v.o.) I've got to stay calm. If I can just keep my wits about me, I can't mess this one up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE'S THOUGHTS (v.o.) Maybe I have been too harsh with him. If I had given him more support in the beginning, maybe things would be different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER'S THOUGHTS (v.o.) Forget it. It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE'S THOUGHTS (v.o.) That's sweet of you, Ted. I appreciate the thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear both of their thoughts simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: STRIKER'S ELAINE'S
dialogues.text: THOUGHTS (v.o.)                  THOUGHTS (v.o.) You know, Elaine, I just         It's just that I feel so wanted to tell you...            helpless and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER'S THOUGHTS (v.o.) Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE'S THOUGHTS (v.o.) No, no. You were first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is seated across the aisle from Mrs. Hammen. He fall asleep and slumps over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. HAMMEN (hysterically) He's dead. He's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack wakes up. Disgustedly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK No, I'm not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Schiff is holding the bottle to her shoulder and patting it. It BURPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Angelina is singing to the two black dudes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SISTER ANGELINA 'What you want, Baby I got, What you need, You know I got it. All I'm askin' for Is a little respect When you come home.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumack pours a cup of water. Randy begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK Randy, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Doctor Rumack, I'm scared. I've never been so scared. And besides, I'm twenty-six and I'm not married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK Randy, we're going to make it. You've got to believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hammen enters alcove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. HAMMEN Lorison, do you have any idea when we'll be landing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK It will be pretty soon. How are you bearing up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. HAMMEN Well, to be honest, I'm very scared. But at least I've got a husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revolving radar antenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of typewriter. CAMERA PULLS OUT to REVEAL Dispatcher typi message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RADIO (v.o.) National Weather Service reporting Chicago ceiling zero, visibility one hundred feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With great care the Dispatcher turns the knob on carriage until the paper comes out clean. Relishing his victory, h talks in Donald Duck voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISPATCHER Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he starts toward the door, the room caves in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey and Kramer are at watercooler. McCroskey is filling cup while Kramer drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Rex, I've decided that the best thing to do is to foam the runway -- let him do a wheels-up landing. It'd be a lot simpler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer throws cup into wastebasket. McCroskey drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (filling up another cup) No, the risk of fire is too great. If she starts burning, you write off all those people who can't get out of there on their own power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey throws cup into wastebasket. Kramer drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (filling up another cup) Well that's better than writing them all off? Are you going to play God with a hundred and 38 lives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer throws cup into wastebasket as McCroskey drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (filling up another cup) No. A belly landing isn't all that simple. It takes a good pilot to keep from smearin' himself all over the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey throws cup into wastebasket as Kramer drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (filling up another cup) If Striker has the guts to try this, he deserves the best shot we can give him. We've gotta foam that runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer throws cup into wastebasket as McCroskey drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (taking another cup) His only shot's with the wheels down. I've seen foam tear a man's guts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey throws cup into wastebasket. Kramer throws cup into wastebasket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY And if Striker goes to pieces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (taking another cup) That's a risk we'll just have to take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer throws cup into wastebasket. McCroskey throws cup into wastebasket. They burp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker is looking at controls. Lightning is flashing on face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSE fighter plane. Then STOCK FOOTAGE of early experimental planes crashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE (v.o.) Stay in formation. Targets just ahead. Target should be clear it you go in low enough. You'll have to decide. (echoing) You'll have to decide. You'll have to decide...So, decide already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden dramatic MUSIC. The cockpit shakes. Engine number three is flaming out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Rats! I've lost number three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE What happened, Ted? What went wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Oil pressure. I forgot to check the oil pressure. When Kramer hears about this, the shit's gonna hit the fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shit hits it. PULL BACK to include:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER I told him to watch that oil temperature. What the hell's he doing up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Striker, that plane can't land itself! It takes a pilot who can handle pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Ease up, Rex! He hasn't flown for years! It's not his fault. It could happen to any pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW It happened to Barbara Stanwyck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER He's right. I can't take the pressure. I was crazy to think I could land this plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE But Ted, you're the only...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER I don't care. I just don't have what it takes. They'd be better off with someone who'd never flown before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Striker leaves he puts autopilot into pilot's seat. Elaine is on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Controller #2 enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #2 Bad news. The fog's getting thicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW And Liz Taylor is getting larger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Ya know, this would be a tough landing for anyone to make. Maybe, if we hold them off for a bit we'll get a break in the weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER All right, but let's wait until they reach the control area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER and lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside stewardess' alcove. Striker fills a cup from drinking fountain then pours it on his head. He sits down dejectedly on stewardess' fold-out seat. Rumack approache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER I know what you're going to say, so save your breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumack sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK No. I haven't a thing to say. You've done the best you could. You really have. The best you could. I guess we can't expect to win 'em all. I want to tell you something I've kept to myself for years. I was in the war myself -- the Medical Corps. I was on duty late one night when a badly wounded pilot was brought in from a raid. He could barely talk, but he looked at me and he said, "Doc. The odds were against us up there but we went in anyway, and I'm glad we did. The captain made the right decision." The pilot's name was George Zipp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker looks up. Notre Dame Fight Song is heard in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER George Zipp said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK And the last thing he said to me, "Doc," he said, "Sometime when the crew is up against it and the breaks are beating the boys, tell them to go out there with all they've got and win just one for the Zipper. I don't know where I'll be then, Doc," he said, "but I won't smell too good. That's for sure."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (rejuvinated) Excuse me, Doc, I've got a plane to land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker boldly starts toward cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker enters. Elaine, unaware of his return, is listeni to Kramer on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) All right, you'd better stay up there for a bit. As soon as the fog lifts, we'll bring you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER I'll take it, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to face him. A dramatic moment. Striker enters pilot seat and takes mike from Elaine's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Listen to me, Kramer. Doctor Rumack says the sick people are in critical condition and every minute counts. We've got to land now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) Don't be a fool, Striker. You know what a landing like this means. You more than anybody. I'm ordering you to stay up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER No dice, Chicago. I'm giving the orders, and we're coming in...I guess the foot's on the other hand now, isn't it, Kramer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY He'll never bring it down in this soup. Never! Not one chance in a million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER I know. I know. But it's his ship now, his command; he's in charge, he's the boss, the head man, the top dog, the big cheese, the head honcho...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Controller #2 rushes up to McCroskey and Kramer, carrying a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR CONTROLLER #2 Chief, look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer grabs newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (reading) 'Passengers Certain to Die?!?!?!?!?!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY 'Airline Negligent?!?!?!?!?!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the paper to Hinshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW (looking at newspaper) There's a sale at Penny's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey grabs paper from Hinshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (to men in Dispatch) All right, I'll need three men up in the tower. (pointing) You, Neubauer. You, Macias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW Me John. Big tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his ear to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW Wagon train comes three, maybe four day away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into microphone) Stand by, Striker. I'm going to the tower. And good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (into phone) We're going to the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW (excitedly) The tower! Oh! Rapunzel! Rapunzel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER and lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is talking to passengers and demonstrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY In a moment we'll ask you to assume crash positions. Your life jackets are located under your seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Shirley are watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY (v.o.) Remove the jacket and unfold it so that the red arrow points up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Krishnas are watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY (v.o.) Place the jacket over your head, and when I give the word pull the cord under the left side flap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the cord and it inflates into a child's duck- shaped inner tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hinshaw, Kramer, and McCroskey enter. Three Controllers a there. One is wearing a black striped shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIPED CONTROLLER We're all ready, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he makes introductions, they shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIPED CONTROLLER Captain McCroskey, this is Captain Roberts. Captain Kramer, this is Captain Colosimo. Captain Hinshaw, Captain Gatz. Captain Kramer, Captain Gatz. Captain Hinshaw, Captain Roberts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER All right. Colosimo, you'll work the relay. Roberts, double check all air traffic within five miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roberts is scratching his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER And get that finger out of your ear. You don't know where that finger's been! Gunderson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNDERSON Yes, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Did you decide on a runway yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNDERSON Runway niner. It's the longest, and directly into the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW And the foliage looks so pretty this time of year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunderson exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into mike) Striker, you're going to have to work fast. After this message, do not acknowledge any transmission unless you want to ask a question. Do you understand? Striker, Striker, do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Oveur enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. OVEUR Steve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Linda, your husband and the others are alive but unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW Just like Gerald Ford!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Now there's a chance we can save them if Striker can get this plane down on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. OVEUR That isn't much of a chance, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW (appalled) Where did you get that dress? It's an eye- sore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunderson and an assistant are seated in front of radar screens. One of them is a video anti-aircraft game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNDERSON (into microphone) Eight miles. Turn right to heading zero eight niner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into microphone) You are now eight miles from the airport. Turn right to a heading of zero eight niner, throttle back slightly and begin to lose altitude to fifteen hundred feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE (v.o.) We're now at twelve hundred feet, leveling off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (to McCroskey) Steve, I want every light you can get poured on that field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY It's being done right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck is dumping a variety of lamps, fixtures, and ligh bulbs onto the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into mike) Tower to all emergency vehicles. Runway is niner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulances, fire trucks, and police cars start to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) (over P.A.) Airport vehicles take positions one and two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into microphone) Civilian equipment, number three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulances, firetrucks, and police cars speed toward runw They are followed by a baggage truck, fuel truck, a taxi, Coke truck, an ice cream truck, farm machinery, and a cem mixer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) (over P.A.) Air Force positions number four and five. All ambulances to position three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW (into mike) It's a twister! It's a twister! Toto!... Auntie Em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER and lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) All right, Striker, put down twenty degrees of flap. When your flaps are down, retrim for level flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers are wearing headsets and watching in-flight movie. Randy approaches Mrs. Schiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SCHIFF Stewardess, how soon 'til we land?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY It won't be long now. Try not to worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Schiff puts on a headset and watches movie. The movi is airplanes crashing and burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flying erratically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fluctuating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman, applying facial makeup, smears it all over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNDERSON He's all over the place! Nine hundred feet up to thirteen hundred feet! What an asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Watch your altitude, Striker. It's too erratic. You can't come straight in. You've got enough fuel left for two hours flying. You've got to stay up there 'til we get a break in the weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker reaches for microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER I'll take it, Elaine. (into mike) Listen, Kramer, I'm coming in. Do you hear me? I'm coming in right now! We have people up here who will die in less than an hour, never mind two. I may bend your precious airplane, but I'll get it down! Now get on with the landing check. I'm putting the gear down now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he activates landing gear, Randy enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Mr. Striker, the passengers are ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Thank you, Randy. You better leave sweetheart. You might get hurt in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy leaves. There is a CRASH and Randy screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE Ted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE I wanted you to know -- now -- I'm very proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER Tell them the gear is down and we're ready to land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE (into mike) The gear is down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE (v.o.) And we're ready to land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY He may not be able to fly, but he's sure got guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in Striker's cab cheeks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUSINESSMAN Well, I'll give him another twenty minutes, but that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fog, THUNDER, and lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON I'm sure we'll both make it...but just in case one of us...well, is there a message you'd like me to give someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNICE No. I'm all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILTON Just in case I don't have a chance to say goodbye, I want you to know that I haven't spent so many pleasant hours for many years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNICE That's a very nice compliment, and I'd like to say that...you've done the same for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Rumack pokes his head in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK I just wanted to tell you both good luck. We're all counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Now, Striker...hold your present heading, put down full flap, bring your air speed back to a hundred and thirty-five, then I want you to take hold of the throttle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW And stick it in your ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER And stick it in your ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey gives Hinshaw a disapproving look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW (a la Frogsy, the Gremlin) I'll be good, I will, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNDERSON Captain, he's dropping off fast. Almost seven hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Striker, get back to a thousand feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assistant Radar Operator unloads clothes from radar scree wash machine door and puts them into basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNDERSON He's below seven hundred now and he's still going down! 675! 650! 625! 600!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It knocks the radio tower off a building and heads past t John Hancock Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Striker, you're coming in too low! What's your altitude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (v.o.) I don't know. How high was the eighty- ninth floor of the John Hancock Building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNDERSON He's right on the heading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER All right, he's on final now! Put out all runway lights except niner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulance attendants, firemen, and emergency vehicles are readiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Turn on your landing lights, Striker. It's the switch above your right knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker reaches for button above his left knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) No. I said your right knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker pushes button over his right knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landing lights come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey, Kramer, and Mrs. Oveur are nervously watching sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER All right, now just listen carefully. You should be able to see the runway at three hundred feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Oveur clutches Kramer's arm anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Aim to touchdown a third of the way along. There's a slight crosswind from the right, so be ready for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Oveur is clutching Kramer's arm with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER If you land too fast, use your emergency brakes. The red handle is right in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Mrs. Oveur, still watching the sky, has both arms aro Kramer's waist, massaging his chest with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER If that doesn't stop you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer is suddenly aware of what Mrs. Oveur is doing. He gives her a look and she removes her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER If that doesn't stop you, cut the four ignition switches over the co-pilot's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker looks for switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER See them, Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Do you see us now? You should be able to see the field now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker and Elaine are searching for airfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer and McCroskey are tensely trying to spot plane. Mr Oveur is watching, prayerfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searchlights scan field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revolving beacon searches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY It sure is quiet out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Yeah -- too quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Looks like I picked the wrong week to quit sniffing glue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a tube of airplane glue from his shirt pocket an sniffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker and Elaine are searching for airfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer and Mrs. Oveur are anxiously watching the sky. McCroskey is glazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (excited) There he is! (into microphone) Striker, you're coming in too fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (v.o.) I know! I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE (v.o.) (into microphone) He knows! He knows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into microphone) Sound your alarm bell now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine rings alarm bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarm BELL RINGS. Randy is standing in center aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY All right, now, everybody get in crash positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers assume various awkward poses as though plane h just crashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulance attendants anxiously watch sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker sees airport and points it out to Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed is increasing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE Airspeed one twenty-five, one thirty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises her head to look out cockpit window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The runway lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker and Elaine look at each other, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hinshaw has just pulled a plug from an electrical outlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW Just kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runway lights go back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker and Elaine are relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE ...one thirty-five, one forty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Striker, now listen to me. You're coming down too fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker is struggling with steering wheel and sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) Put down thirty degrees of flap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker is sweating profusely as he struggles in vain wit the flap switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER It's stuck. It won't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bangs the control panel and "TILT" light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey is staring at radio equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Bring it down! Easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY Look at all those buttons! Oh that's beautiful! Just beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) Watch your nose! It's too low!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker is struggling with wheel. The wheel begins to fig back, pushing Striker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) You're coming in too hot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Remember your brakes and switches! Get ready to flare it out! You're coming in too fast! Watch your speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (hysterical) He's coming right at us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey turns and leaps through tower window. All activ momentarily stops. Everyone looks back at window. Then activity resumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER You're coming in too hot! Put down full flaps! Watch your nose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runway swerving underneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Now ease her down! Down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plane is a few feet from ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Lift the nose! Throttle back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer to ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker pushes wheel forward as tires SCREECH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER The brake! Pull the red handle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker pulls red handle. It comes off in his hand. He pushes brake with feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Rumack pokes his head in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK I just wanted to tell you both good luck. We're all counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runway passing underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into microphone) Hold her steady, hold her steady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: skidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.A. SYSTEM (v.o.) You attention, please. Trans American Flight 209 non-stop from Los Angeles is now arriving at Gate seven...Gate eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in Gate seven waiting area move to Gate eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is struggling with controls, sweating profusely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Pull a lever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: skidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is struggling with controls. Water is gushing down his fa ridiculously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.A. SYSTEM (v.o.) ...209 arriving gate thirteen...gate fourteen....gate fifteen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in Gate thirteen move to Gate fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: skidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Push a button!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker is struggling with controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (into microphone) You're too low! You're too low!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.A. SYSTEM (v.o.) ...gate twenty-three...twenty four... twenty-five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are running THROUGH FRAME right to left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground crewman with red flashlights nonchalantly directs plane. Suddenly he realizes the plane is not stopping. He throws his flashlight at the plane and runs off, terrifie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: skidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy approaches a passenger in crash position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Can we help arrange hotel accommodations or a rent-a-car during your stay in Chicago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landing gear snaps off; plane starts to slide on its bell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is heading toward a building. On the side of the building a billboard with a man drinking milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine screams and covers her face. St. Christopher statu covers its face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is getting closer to building. Billboard man is looking a plane, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is skidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINSHAW (seated in wheelchair) Wheel me to the West Wing. I wish to view the Degas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer sighs in relief as controllers and Mrs. Oveur dash from room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controllers celebrate safe landing, reporters rush from room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five reporters run into bank of phone booths and the boot topple over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMING ambulances race toward plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers rise slowly, shaken but uninjured. Milton and Bernice look at each other, relieved, and embrace. Mrs. Schiff gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumack pokes his head in door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. RUMACK I just wanted to tell you both good luck. We're all counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker and Elaine get up to leave cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) Striker, Striker, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRIKER (into microphone) Yeah, we're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER Ted, that was probably the lousiest landing in the history of this airport. But there are some of us here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) ...particularly me, who'd like to buy you a drink and shake your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker and Elaine leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) ...and, Ted, I just want you to know, that when the going got tough up there, when the chips were down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is assisting Jack and Shirley, the Hammens, and the nun from the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY Hurry now. Please be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air controllers leave as Kramer continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER ...Lonliness, that's the bottom line. I was never happy as a child. Christmas, Ted, what does it mean to you? For me, it was a living hell. Do you know what it's like to fall in the mud and get kicked? In the head? By an iron boot? Of course you don't. No one does. That never happens. Sorry, Ted. Dumb question. Strike that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is assisting Hari Krishnas and Black Dudes from pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCroskey, dressed in wet suit and flippers and oxygen ta is moving as though swimming under water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCROSKEY (v.o.) I didn't know that the electric eel was approaching so rapidly nor that hidden in the coral reef was a family of poisonous sea urchins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa Davis and her mother enter ambulance. It pulls from FRAME. We HEAR a loud screech and crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kramer is still droning on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRAMER (v.o.) (into mike) ...and they shall be for frontlets between thine eyes, Ted. Neither they man servant, nor they maid servant, nor thine ox, nor thine ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striker and Elaine are alone on the runway. Behind them i flight 209. They embrace and kiss as CAMERA ARCS around. MUSIC SWELLS. Suddenly the ENGINES REV UP. Astonished, th look up to the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Automatic pilot is at controls. He salutes Striker and Elaine and winks at CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane begins to taxi on its belly, shooting off spark and making a tremendous scraping SOUND. Arm in arm, Strik and Elaine wave good-bye as the plane takes off into the night sky.
